references.citationString: Gr端nwald, T., Hehn, M., Moderow, U., Prasse, H., ICOS RI, 2021. ICOS ETC Bio Meteo Raw ASCII, Tharandt, 2021-03-09, https://hdl.handle.net/11676/HN3ilhz3vVUZV2Omqv8Qn98V

comments: The station Tharandt, with ICOS code DE-Tha, is located in the Eastern part of a large forested area, near the city of Tharandt, about 25 Km SW of Dresden. The site is an evergreen needleleaf forest located in the suboceanic/subcontinental climate. The present species are composed of 87% coniferous evergreen (72% Picea abies (L.) H.Karst., 15% Pinus sylvestris L.) and 13% deciduous (10% Larix decidua Mill., 1% Betula spec., 2% others).
self.label: DE-Tha

documentation.name: DE-Tha ICOS Ecosystem Station Labelling Report.pdf

comments: Lands dominated by woody vegetation with a percent cover >60% and height exceeding 2 meters. Almost all trees remain green all year. Canopy is never without green foliage.
ecosystemType.label: Evergreen Needleleaf Forests

self.label: ICOS ETC Bio Meteo Raw ASCII
